Package alex.mojaki.boxes

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Box<T>
    An abstraction of a value similar to pointers in C and other languages that allows obtaining and changing the value in a generic way.
    PowerBox<T>
    A Box which can dynamically change its behaviour regarding its value changing or PowerBox.get() being called.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractPowerBox<T>
    This class supplies the logic of applying middleware and observers stored in a family, without specifying how the value or family is stored.
    AbstractUpgradedBox<T>
    A PowerBox that wraps around a (presumably) plain Box and forwards get and set calls to it.
    BasicBox<T>
    A trivial implementation of the Box interface that simply stores the value as a field.
    BoxFamily
    This class holds metadata for a group of PowerBoxes, including middleware and observers.
    BoxFamily.ParticipantList<E>
    A thread-safe, append-only list of observers/middleware.
    CommonBox<T>
    The simplest concrete implementation of PowerBox.
    CommonUpgradedBox<T>
    A PowerBox that wraps around a (presumably) plain Box and forwards get and set calls to it.
    DefaultPowerBox<T>
    An implementation of PowerBox that stores a value but not a family to save memory.
    ForwardingBox<T>
    A box that wraps around another box and forwards the interface methods and toString.
    ForwardingPowerBox<T>
    A PowerBox that wraps around another PowerBox and forwards the interface methods and toString.
    View<T>
    A PowerBox whose value is calculated based on the values of other PowerBoxes and knows when those boxes change, allowing it to safely cache its own value to save computation and notify ChangeObservers that the result of its calculation is now different.
    WrapperBox<T>
    A box which implements the same interface as the type of the value it contains and notifies its ChangeObservers when it is mutated via the WrapperBox.change() method.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Boxes
    Container for static factory methods producing boxes of various kinds.
